response.answer_text: Ex NY Doll Johnny Thunders wrote the song “Downtown” and it can be found on his solo album “So Alone”. Well off the beaten path to all except survivors of NYC’s late 70’s Alphabet City heroin hub, the song is antithesis of the better known and completely different song with the same name. A harrowing and resigned portrayal of opiate addiction and its’ tragic aftermath. The narrative is one of longing, loss, regret; all dead panned with a wink from an originator of “heroin chick” and an infamous career spun almost in its entirety from negation and death.
